utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hu-u-u-uh…. Hu-u-u-uh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Thai food.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We don’t have Thai food on Thursday. We have pizza on Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, but we all agreed that the third Thursday of every month would be Anything Can Happen Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well apparently the news didn’t reach my digestive system, which, when startled, has its own version of Anything Can Happen Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, the whole idea behind Anything Can Happen Thursday is to get out of this rut we’ve been in lately.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rut? I think you mean consistency. And if we’re going to abandon that, then why even call it Thursday? Let’s call it Quonko Day and divide it into 29 hours of 17 minutes apiece, and celebrate it by sacrificing a goat to the mighty god Ra.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I could go for some goat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, we agreed we’d do something different tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go to the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We went to the comic book store last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Last night was Wednesday. Wednesday is comic book night. Tonight, we’ll be going on Thursday, because it’s Anything Can Happen Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Way to think outside but pressed right up against the box, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So what are we going to do tonight?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If I may proffer a suggestion, in bars all across this great nation of ours, Thursday night is Ladies’ Night. Which means, as the evening progresses, we will get better looking courtesy of 99 cent margaritas and two-for-one Jell-O shots.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, Howard, the odds of us picking up girls in a bar are practically zero.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? Are you familiar with the Drake Equation?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The one that estimates the odds of making contact with extraterrestrials by calculating the product of an increasingly restrictive series of fractional values such as those stars with planets, and those planets likely to develop life? N equals R times FP times NE times FL times FI times FC times L?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, that one. You can modify it to calculate our chances of having sex by changing the formula to use the number of single women in Los Angeles, the number of those who might find us attractive, and what I call the Wolowitz Coefficient.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The Wolowitz Coefficient?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Neediness times dress size squared. Crunching the numbers, I come up with a conservative 5,812 potential sex partners within a 40-mile radius.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re joking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m a horny engineer, Leonard. I never joke about math or sex.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, what are we waiting for? Let’s bounce, bitches.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right. It’s Anything Can Happen Thursday, let’s hit the clubs and meet hot women!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here we go. Lock up your daughters! We’re going to hit it and quit it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Or we could finish eating and go to the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Also a good plan.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Alright, but next Anything Can Happen Thursday, we’re definitely going to a bar.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You heard that, Ladies’ Night ladies? We’re eventually coming for you!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh hey, guys, where’re you headed?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To the comic book store. You’re probably thinking, the comic book store? On a Thursday? Why, I’ve fallen down the rabbit hole and into a land of madness. What you have failed to take into account, Penny, is that this is Anything Can Happen Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You got me. While you’re there, could pick me up a few comics for my nephew’s birthday?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think you mean comic books. Comics are feeble attempts at humour featuring talking babies and anthropomorphized pets found traditionally in the optimistically named funny pages.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, could you pick me up a few comics for my nephew’s birthday?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. What does he like?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know, he’s 13. Just pick out anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just pick out anything? Maybe at the same time we can pick out a new suit for him without knowing his size, or pick out his career for him without knowing his aptitude, or pick out a new breakfast cereal without knowing his fibre requirements or his feelings about little marshmallows.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Spider-Man. Get him Spider-Man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amazing Spider-Man, Ultimate Spider-Man, Spectacular Spider-Man, The Marvelous Adventures of Spider-Man, Spider-Man 2099?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know this can go on all night, why don’t you just come with us?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, that’s what I was trying to avoid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I forgot Sensational Spider-Man.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, what a cute, little store. Everybody’s staring at me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t worry, they’re more scared of you than you are of them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Unlikely. Here, what about this one for my nephew?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A superb choice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, provided he has already read Infinite Crisis and 52, and is familiar with the re-establishment of the DC multiverse.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s a multiverse?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Get her out of here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, I’ll help you pick something.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s right. She’s with us. Guys like that are so pathetic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tell me about it. Look, a new Batman belt buckle.

utterance.speaker: Store clerk
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Leonard. Can I help you find something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Stuart. This is Penny. She’s looking for some comic books.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, really. Blink twice if you’re here against your will.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think we’re fine, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Let me know if you need anything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. He seems like a nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You mean for someone who’s into comic books?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, I just meant for… yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, just because people appreciate comic books doesn’t make them weirdos. Stuart’s a terrific artist. He went to the Rhode Island School of Design.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What about the guy over there in the superhero T-shirt tucked into his sweatpants?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, that’s Captain Sweatpants. He doesn’t really help the point I’m trying to make.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let it go, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why should I let it go? I saw it first.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but I saw it from the front.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A far less impressive feat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on! I need this for my Batman collection.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need it for my Robin collection.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would I gamble? It’s mine. Let go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You let go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, you!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, he won’t let go of my comic book.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s my comic book!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, we need a ruling.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, cut it in half?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hello again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. What would you recommend as a present for a 13-year-old boy?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: A 13-year-old girl. But if you’re dead set on a comic book, try this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Hellblazer. What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: A morally ambiguous confidence man who smokes, has lung cancer and is tormented by the spirits of the undead.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, if that doesn’t make me the favourite aunt, I don’t know what will. Is this me?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Depends. Do you like it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s really good.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yes, that’s you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s so sweet, but what if I didn’t like it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’d still be you, but I’d feel like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t believe it. Stuart’s putting the moves on Penny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have got to learn how to draw. Hey!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Once again, defeated by your own prurient interests.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Guys, have you seen Stuart all up in Penny’s business over there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nobody’s up in anybody’s business, let’s just buy our stuff and go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you’ve got my number, now, give me the picture.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You drive a hard bargain, but here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. So, um, just give me a call.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, Leonard, how are you enjoying Anything Can Happen Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at that, that’s a dent. Thank you, Howard Ham-Fisted Wolowitz. Did you just shut the TV off in the middle of the classic Deep Space Nine/Star Trek The Original Series Trouble With Tribbles crossover episode?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Apparently so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you ill?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Then is it fair to say that you’re experiencing some sort of emotional turmoil over the events involving Penny earlier this evening?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When did you pick up on that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A moment ago, when you turned off the TV in the middle of }during the classic Deep Space Nine/Star Trek The Original Series Trouble With Tribbles crossover episode. Would you like some advice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then, this is the perfect time to launch a blog with an interactive comments section.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gee, thanks a lot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you rather I offer my personal insight?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t need any insights. I just want to know why Penny’s more interested in Stuart than me. We’re practically the same guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I disagree. Stuart is taller, artistic, self-employed and, most significantly, he gets 45 percent off comic books.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right, I really should be asking strangers on the Internet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My original point.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chinese food, vintage video games. After the nightmare of Anything Can Happen Thursday, this is Friday night the way it was meant to be.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who’s up for Sheldon-Free Saturday?

utterance.speaker: Penny (coming out of apartment)
utterance.content: Oh, hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny… and Stuart, hey Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So what are you kids up to?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, Stuart has a piece in an art show that’s opening tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you guys are going together, great…

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It is great. Really great. Freaking awesome. What are you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s Friday night, that means Chinese food and vintage video games, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Vintage doesn’t even begin to describe what we have planned. Tonight, we are playing the classic 1980 interactive text adventure, Zork. It’s the buggy beta version.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, Zork. Well, you guys have fun.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, see you guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: See you, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Take me to a bar with women.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay! Let me just go inside and slip off my underwear.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, if I get lucky, I don’t want to be caught in my Aquaman briefs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to Raj)
utterance.content: Do you…? Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: May I have a grasshopper with a little umbrella, please?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, he may not.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not sitting here with a guy drinking a grasshopper with a little umbrella.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll have a chocolate martini.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wrong again!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, you know I can’t talk to women unless I’m lit up like the Hindu festival of Diwali.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, there are plenty of bars in Los Angeles where you can order grasshoppers and chocolate martinis, but you wouldn’t have to because there are no women in them.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Gotcha. I’ll have a Brandy Alexander.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, the Three Musketeers just became the Dynamic Duo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Should we talk to some of these women?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s way too early in the night for that. See, first we let the lawyers and the jocks thin the herd, and then we go after the weak and the old and the lame.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s your system?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s my system. Oh, and if you spot a chick with a Seeing Eye dog, she’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh come on. I think it’s nice that Captain Sweatpants showed up to your art opening.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, it would have been nicer if he hadn’t touched all the cheese.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, you know, it’s kind of early. Do you want to maybe come in for some coffee or something?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, gee, it’s a little late for coffee, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you think coffee, means coffee, that is so sweet. Come on, I think I have decaf.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, Stuart, I thought I heard your voice. Do you have a moment?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, we’re a little busy here, so…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: We’re having coffee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Isn’t it a little late for coffee?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’s okay. She thinks she has decaf.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ll just go look for it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’ve spent the last three hours in an online debate in the DC Comics Batman chatroom, and I need your help.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Those guys can be very stubborn. What’s the topic?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am asserting, in the event that Batman’s death proves permanent, that original Robin, Dick Grayson, is the logical successor to the Bat Cowl.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ooh, Sheldon, I’m afraid you couldn’t be more wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: More wrong? Wrong is an absolute state and not subject to gradation.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Of course it is. It’s a little wrong to say a tomato is a vegetable, it’s very wrong to say it’s a suspension bridge. But returning to the original issue, Dick Grayson became Nightwing, a superhero in his own right. Batman 2 has to be the second Robin, Jason Todd.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Has to be? Has to be? I hope you’re being deliberately provocative.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I found the decaf!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, great!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, herbal tea for me, please.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Barkeep! Alexander me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How about those two?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nah, they’re eating peanuts, and my allergies, one kiss would put me in Cedar-Sinai for a week.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about the ones in the corner?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Possible, very possible. Do you want the one in the whiplash collar or the one who keeps blinking?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think Blinky’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You got it, sir.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, so we just go over there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, we have a little prep work to do. Put this in your mouth. We walk past them, you stumble a bit. I say, sorry, my friend’s had a little too much, and then I start to pull it out of your mouth and say, a little too much fun. Get it? I mean, they’re laughing, we’re laughing, and then we get them up to about a .15 blood alcohol level, and tell them we’re millionaires.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What else you got?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Depends. Are you willing to sit on my lap and pretend to be a ventriloquist dummy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t sit on your lap, you don’t know the routine.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but you’re obviously stuck in a pre-Zero Hour DC universe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course I am. Removing Joe Chill as the killer of Batman’s parents effectively deprived him of his raison d’être.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, you can throw all the French around you want, it doesn’t make you right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Au contraire.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Plus, you’re forgetting that the Infinite Crisis storyline restored Joe Chill to the Batman mythology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am forgetting nothing and I resent your tone.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, look, Sheldon, it’s late and I’ve got to get some sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, I win.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, I’m tired.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, I win.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Fine. You win.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Darn tootin’, I win.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Penny, I really had a terrific time. Penny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, don’t wake her. She’ll maul you like a rabid wolverine.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You know, I don’t think that was decaf.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, is this your card or isn’t it? Trust me, this was their card.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you were good at this. You’re always talking about how you go to bars and meet women.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I do, all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what happened? We’ve been sitting here all night and the longest conversation you’ve had with a woman was when your mom called.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, you’re just going to make me come out and say it, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Say what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re weighing me down. I’m a falcon who hunts better solo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll sit here. You take flight and hunt.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t be ridiculous, you can’t just tell a falcon when to hunt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, you can. There’s a whole sport built around it. Falconry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Shut up. Let’s just get Koothrappali and go. Lucky bastard. It’s got to be that stupid accent of his. Hello. I am Sanjay Wolowitz from Bombay. Okay, I’m stumped.
